Project ISIPS (Project Intensifying Students and Teachers’ Innovative Power and Skills) Manpower Building, General Trias City | September 12-13, 2019
IT Students exhibit research projects to more than 1000 high school students of Luis Y. Ferrer Sr. National High School, facilitate basic Arduino programming and applications to elementary, high school and senior high school students and teachers of Cluster 2 and 3 of Department of Education-General Trias City Division, and mentor in project development

Mr. Jay Paul Felizardo, Art3san Vice President, wins Champion in Best Photo Contest “Interplaying Hardware and Software: Intensifying Innovation and Research” while Mr. Nathaniel Louie Arca was awarded as Best Photo 2ND Runner Up ”Luminescence of Ideas” during the Research and Extension Week 2019. Held last September 12, 2019 at International Convention Center CvSU Main Campus.

Manila Mini Maker Faire Arduino-based Projects Display Exhibit The Mind Museum, Taguig City June 22-23, 2019
League of Information Technology Leaders’ President together with IT instructors presented Arduino-based Projects.

Development of Arduino-based Generic Water Quality Devices by Ivan Jogadilla and John Lester Pindot 3 Place Best Arduino-based Project rd 1 Cavite Arduino-based Research Forum and Exhibit st April 22, 2019

IT Students facilitate workshop on Simple Automation using Arduino Technology during Division Science in- Service Training 2019 of Department of Education-Division of General Trias City. Activity held at Manpower Building General Trias City on May 27-29, 2019

Mr. Nerwin Bañez won first place on Best Arduino Porject during World Arduino Day 2018-Cavite sponsored by Sparkfruit Philippines. Activity held at Magno Building, Trece Martires City on May 12, 2018.
